description: Borrowed from Italian pozz(u)olana, earth of Pozzuoli, a town near Naples, itself from Latin Puteoli, ultimately from the verb puteō (“stink”).

entries.meaning: A type of volcanic ash used for mortar or for cement which sets under water. [from 17th c.]
examples: Finally the street is strewn with pozzolana to prevent the horses from slipping on the smooth paving.
